data.title: Great Cold Brew
data.text: A cozy joint.  My latte was perfect.  My wife is the cold brew expert and she said it's the best.  It's right next to Joes Real BBQ, so you could do lunch and get that PM boost afterward.

data.title: Best local Coffee!!!!
data.text: I love this place! I love the owner and I love that they have not only live music on the weekends, but that they offer classes in how to brew the best coffee and pick the best coffee. Not only do they have amazing coffee and the nicest patio to hang out with you dog, but they have some pretty darn tasty teas as well as baked goods. Love this place!!

data.title: Very popular!
data.text:
A tiny coffee shop (inside, very limited seating) with a lovely large outdoor area offering multiple seating options (some with shade) in a garden setting. We showed up early Sunday morning surprised to find live music playing - while good music, the volume prevented conversation.

If you know what you want, a good place to go....if you show up, like we did, at a busy time (even though it was early on a Sunday) don't expect great customer service as understandably they're swamped (gets very noisy inside). 

Limited organic options - seems to be good quality coffee but wasn't my preferred of the coffee shops visited in Arizona. However, worth it for the pleasant outdoor atmosphere (if it's not too hot!)

data.title: Very cool coffee place with awesome outdoor garden seating
data.text:
This is a really rare gem in the world of Starbucks and chain stores (and I'm a fan of Starbucks, mind you).  

Right in the heart of downtown Gilbert, on the main drag, is this coffee shop. 

It's a tiny house on like a half acre.  The coffee shop itself is in the house, and there is only a small amount of seating in there (but there is some).

Their coffee menu looks awesome, with a huge variety of teas and coffee, all handmade.  They have cold-brew (and sell growlers of cold brew!) and cubanos, and all kinds of great drinks.  

I've had non-sweet espresso drinks and cold-brews there only, my friends have had some neat flavored tea concoctions that they loved.

But the key part about this is the outside seating.  It's this cool huge outside area with garden areas and tables and such.  Just beautiful!  At least when the weather isn't summer in Phoenix.

Plus they have had live music a couple of times we've been there.

This is the perfect place to chill out during the day in winter, or after dinner coffee and relaxing with friends.

data.title: Nice patio
data.text: Great coffee and a charming patio right next to the BBQ joint,so be careful, you'll want to amble over there for lunch.But for breakfast have some coffee and a fresh pastry here while you plan your day of antique-ing in historic downtown Gilbert!

data.title: Another Gilbert Gem!
data.text: Great location! Delicious coffee in a great outdoor setting. As a local, I love taking my out of town guests here so they can experience "life outside a Starbucks". Everyone has loved it!

data.title: Pleasant Outdoor Cafe
data.text: My wife & I looked for a place to have coffee & a pastry while waiting for a friend, and Bergies looked relaxed and inviting.  Thankfully, it was February, so the temperature was very nice, and sitting outside amongst lovely flowers and interesting bric-a-brac was delightful.  We chose iced coffees and a cinnamon roll which came iced in butter & sprinkled with cinnamon.  It seemed to be a popular place with business people meeting and chatting while others worked on their phones and laptops at the various small tables scattered around the garden.  Most pleasant.  We'd do it again.

data.title: Coffee!
data.text: Nice small coffee shop with a great outdoor sitting area!! Just have a seat and watch the world go by!!

data.title: great location
data.text: Berries has a e great location in down town Gilbert, The coffee house sits in the back of the lot with a verry nice garden area with lots of plants trees and tables to sit back in and watch the world go buy. A nice selection of coffees and teas enhances the Bergies experience. Will be down there soon to take it all in again.

data.title: Great place for Coffee & Nature
data.text: Love this place! Not only is the coffee good, but the garden is amazing. I love to sit in the garden with my cup of coffee and enjoy the beautiful flowers and the beautiful weather in AZ. If you happen to visit when they are roasting coffee beans, the smell is amazing. Yes, they roast their own coffee beans. There is a great selection of coffee and a choice of milk or cream: almond milk, coconut milk, soy milk. Very personalized and delicious. We live in Gilbert, so we visit often.

data.title: What a super cool, happening, local spot!
data.text:
I actually found out about this place Christmas Day but, of course, it was closed. I hoped to stop by when I came back through. I didn't know it would be so soon. When I woke up in Mesa this morning, I knew were I was headed. 

I just got here and am already reviewing it. It's that good. Coffee is great and staff is friendly, blah blah blah. What's cool is the coziness of the cafe. It's very tiny but that's ok because they have this awesome patio outside. It would be perfect for sitting down with someone and chatting. 

This place is super busy. The funny thing is, it seemed that I was the only stranger. They practically knew every other person that walked in. 

Don't like how busy it is? No problem. They have a cozy little room in the corner with soft seating. 

They have all of my standards: free wifi, stand up work stations, drip coffee, and a super cute barista.

data.title: Great atmosphere!
data.text: I love this local coffee house.  Not only is the coffee excellent, the garden is fun and relaxing.  A great place to spend some time with friends any time of the day or evening.

data.title: Stopped in for a cold drink
data.text: Stopped in for a cold drink, after riding our bikes around downtown. The fruit smoothie was average and cost was a little high. The outdoor setting sets this coffee shop apart from most area eat establishments. Enjoyed seating outside in the fresh air.

data.title: Life after Starbucks
data.text:
Great wee coffee house with great outside seating good coffee and cakes 
Nice to sit outside in the garden and have a coffee with your girl 
Much better than your average Starbucks 
Go on give "spend bucks " a miss

data.title: Nice place for a coffee break. :)
data.text: Fun local coffee spot that has music some evenings.  Great location, with nice atmosphere.  They have some very good teas.

data.title: Delicious coffee in a pretty setting
data.text: A lovely little coffee place in downtown Gilbert. Delicious coffee and espresso drinks, great service and pretty surrounding. At night it's even more beautiful with lots of white lights on the outdoor patio and plenty of places to sit and enoy your coffee. They even have live music you can enjoy some evenings. Delightful place with great coffee!

data.title: Now that's some coffee!!
data.text: Bergies is a great place to meet up with a friend, do some studying/reading or just enjoy an awesome cup of coffee.

data.title: Unique place. Great Coffee
data.text: I love the cool patio area.  I love the vibe.  And I always enjoy my Coffee there.  Cool staff too.  On Saturday mornings they are also at the Farmers Market across the street. It's just a cool place in the middle of the hoppin Downtown Gilbert.

data.title: Very Cool Coffee House
data.text: Arrived at just about sunset after eating dinner, and the "yard" was full of people, and there was some acoustic music being played.  People of all ages were there sitting back enjoying what is probably the last of our cool weather for a while.  We went inside and the actual coffe house is a House!  There is artwork from locals for sale all over the walls, and the staff behind the bar were very helpful and accommdating.  Coffee was not nearly as bitter as Starbucks (which I do enjoy), but the flavor was so much more rich (i get medium dark roast, three shots of espresso and cream) and flavorful that I wish I lived in gilbert so I could get my caffine fix more conveniently.  Great place, definitely stop by if you're in the area.

data.title: Funky, Quaint, Charming, and Relaxing
data.text: I am not a coffee drinker, but my friends are so I have visited Bergies a few times this Spring. The atmosphere is very relaxing. You can chat with your friends for hours on end and never feel rushed. The quirky decor gives it a lot of character, too. It is a great place to visit if you enjoy sitting outdoors ... even if you are "only" a tea drinker like myself.
